summary: The Maryland State Board of Physicians denied Aubrey Ancil King, M.D.'s application for an initial medical license due to prior disciplinary action in California. His California license was placed on probation for four years following findings of gross negligence and repeated negligent acts in the care of two adolescent patients, including inappropriate psychotropic medication prescribing. The Maryland Board concluded his conduct constituted unprofessional conduct and a failure to meet appropriate standards.
